item.title: Pokemon Fan Designs Sneakers Inspired by Shiny Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Pokemon fan designs shiny Pokemon sneakers, including Gyrados and Yveltal, staying true to each Pokemon's unique design and color scheme.
  • Sneaker designs for Groudon, Luxray, and Decidueye include specific details like spikes, star tail, and iconic leaf/cross symbols.
  • The Pokemon community continues to express its love for the franchise.

A Pokemon fan recently designed several sneakers based on popular shiny Pokemon throughout the games. Featuring community favorites such as Gyrados, this Pokemon fan created some fun and interesting designs for these sneakers, while staying true to the designs of the original Pokemon.

The Pokemon community has been known to create some truly great fan art. Ranging from Pokemon clay sculptures to original designs for new Pokemon, the community is always finding ways to interact with the franchise while flexing their creative muscles. Like any fan base, the Pokemon community continuously finds unique ways to express their love of the franchise and its interesting Pokemon.

Reddit user MelodicWeb2161 took this love of the Pokemon franchise to the next level by designing a unique line of sneakers based on popular shiny Pokemon found throughout the different games. Their collection featured designs based on shiny versions of Gyrados, Yveltal, Groudon, Gigalith, Staraptor, Decidueye, Luxray, and Haxorus. The designs took into account the color scheme and overall aesthetic of each Pokemon, even including small details such as Gigalith's iconic eyes being incorporated into the Nike logo on that specific design.

Pokemon Fan Designs Sneakers Based on Pokemon

Alongside the addition of Gigalith's eye being incorporated into the logo, several other aspects of these shiny Pokemon were accounted for in the sneaker designs. Both Groudon and Gigalith's designs also come with studs attached to the shoes' toebox, mimicking the spikes present on each of these Pokemon. Luxray's design features the star tail of the Pokemon on the shoe, similar to how Decidueye's shoe design includes the iconic leaf and cross that is on that Pokemon's chest. Even Yveltal's lightning-esque pattern is featured on that Pokemon's shoe design.

This isn't the first time that a Pokemon fan designed sneakers based on a Pokemon. In fact, this Reddit user had designed several other sneakers based on shiny Pokemon before drawing up these designs. Alongside that, this Reddit user also creates physical versions of these shoes, as mentioned in the comments of the post.

Whether it is creating physical art of shiny Pokemon on sneakers or drawing up original designs for Pokeballs, the Pokemon community is clearly not lacking in the creativity department. Fans continue to find new ways of interacting with the franchise, and it seems that there is no end in sight to the community's endless love for Pokemon. With more exciting Pokemon content on the way in the near future, time will tell what fan creations the community will see next.

item.title: Warhammer 40000: Space Marine 2 â€“ 6 Thousand Sons Confirmed To Be In The Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Face off against the Thousand Sons, Chaos Space Marines dedicated to Tzeentch, offering a unique challenge in Space Marine 2.
  • From Tzaangors to Exalted Sorcerers, prepare to battle aggressive Psykers and powerful leaders within the chapter.
  • Watch out for Helbrutes and Heldrakes, formidable foes with demonic powers and deadly weapons.

While a lot of the marketing for Space Marine 2 focuses on the Tyranids, players will also be coming face to face with the Thousand Sons, a chapter of Chaos Space Marines that is made up entirely of Psykers. During the Horus Heresy, the Thousand Sons turned on the Emperor and became a traitor legion, later falling to Chaos completely.

The Thousand Sons follow Tzeentch, the Chaos god of change, and will bring a sharp change of pace when fighting them compared to the Tyranids. While the Tyranids focus on overwhelming the enemy with sheer numbers, the Thousand Sons will be on much more equal footing against the Ultramarines you'll be playing as. Here's every Thousand Sons enemy confirmed to be in the game.

6 Tzaangors / Chaos Cultists

Small Fodder In The Thousand Sons

  • Weak creatures that focus on numbers to win.
  • Aggressive melee and ranged combatants despite their weak stature.

Tzaangors are abhuman beastmen followers of Tzeentch that act as the lowest level in the Thousand Sons army. These creatures are born in a few different ways, all of which spawn from Tzeentch creating them from those who have been touched by the warp.

Tzaangors may not seem like much against a Space Marine, but they are incredibly aggressive and violent. Chaos Cultists are roughly the same size as Tzaangors but have kept their human characteristics and choose to fight with guns instead of melee weapons in this game. While these are two units, they seem fairly similar in terms of stats and how easy they are to cut down with a chainsword, making them the melee and ranged basic Thousand Sons units you'll be fighitng.

5 Rubric Marine

Basic Space Marines Of The Thousand Sons

  • Known for Warpfire weapons.
  • The same strength as the Space Marines you'll be playing as.

Rubric Marines are the basic Space Marines of the Thousand Sons. They have a few different weapons that are unique to their chapter, such as the Warpflame guns. As all Rubric Marines are Psykers, a lot of their weapons channel power from the warp to make them a bigger threat than just your average bolter.

Rubric Marines will stand at eye level against Titus and his Space Marines, making them a much larger threat individually than most single Tyranids. While Rubric Marines tend to favor ranged weapons, some also use Force weapons that also channel the warp and can be even more deadly than a Chainsword.

4 Scarab Occult Terminator

Terminator Variant Of The Thousand Sons

  • Wields both melee and ranged weapons.
  • Much stronger armor than regular Space Marines.

Scarab Occult Terminators are the Thousand Sons version of a terminator that wears much heavier armor than that of a normal Space Marine. With their larger armor size and capacity, they are able to wield heavy ranged weapons such as a Soulreaper Cannon in one hand, while still having a Force weapon out and ready in the other.

Scarab Occult Terminators will be much harder to kill than regular Rubric Marines, yet also much more deadly, meaning they should be your first target in fights against multiple enemies at once.

3 Exalted Sorcerer

Powerful Psykers That Are Leaders In The Chapter

  • Leaders within the Thousand Sons.
  • Offensive and defensive spells, often support those around them.

While all members of the Thousand Sons are Psykers, some are much more in tune with the warp than others. Exalted Sorcerers are some of the strongest Psyker in an army made of Psykers, and are leaders within the chapter.

The range of psychic abilities has yet to be seen within the game, but Exalted Sorcerers have both powerful offensive and defensive spells in the lore and on the tabletop, making it safe to assume they will be major threats when faced in Space Marine 2 .

2 Helbrute

Demonic-Infused Dreadnoughts That Dominate Combat

  • Dominate in melee combat with powerful axes and demonic fists.
  • Surprisingly quick in combat despite their size.

Helbrutes are chaos-infected Dreadnoughts, whose weapons vary greatly. Dreadnoughts are essentially living coffins for mortally wounded Space Marines that keep them alive and fighting alongside their brothers. When the Thousand Sons fell to chaos, these Dreadnought became infected with demonic powers that strengthened the already deadly force of the Dreadnought.

Related
Which Warhammer 40K Space Marine Chapter Would You Join?

The Ultramarines are said to be the strongest chapter of all Space Marines, but that's not to say that the rest aren't incredibly devastating and effective in battle. I love the fire element of the Salamanders, as well as the lore behind the fabled Space Wolves.

Helbrutes come with powerful ranged weapons and even more deadly melee weapons, making them one of the toughest enemies players will face in Space Marine 2 .

1 Heldrake

Massive Fire-Breathing Dragon-Like Creatures

  • Fly high above the battlefield.
  • Mix of machine and demonic strengths.

Heldrakes are massive demonic engines that become infected with a demonic spirit in order to keep that spirit tethered to the material, or realspace. Heldrakes are massive creatures that usually fly high overhead and spew fire down on their enemies below.

The fire itself is infused with the demon's hatred and warp energy, making it very deadly, even to a Space Marine. Due to the size and strength of Heldrakes, it's clear they will at least be a mini-boss enemy, if not a difficult boss fought at the end of a mission. It's also quite common for Heldrakes to hunt in packs, which would be an incredibly challenging fight for even an experienced Space Marine.

item.title: Best Animal Villains In Games, Ranked
item.description:
There are plenty of animal protagonists found in the world of video games, but there are also plenty of villainous animal antagonists who are just as memorable as their heroic counterparts.

Here's a look at some of the best animal villains in gaming, but a few rules are going to be bent to narrow down who is qualified for the list. First off, mythical animals are allowed, despite not being real animals. They are based on real animals after all, so it only seems fair to let them in. Anti-heroes and animals that appear as boss fights are also fair game, especially those that are particularly iconic.

8 Shadow the Hedgehog

Edge Lord

  • Sonic the Hedgehog franchise
  • Japanese VA: KÅji Yusa (2001â€“present)
  • English VA: David Humphrey (2001-2004), Jason Griffith (2004-2010), Kirk Thornton (2010-Present), Ian Hanlin ( Sonic Prime show), and Keanu Reeves (upcoming movie Sonic the Hedgehog 3 ).

First up is a character that isnâ€™t really a villain per se, but more of an antihero. Shadow the Hedgehog appears here as he is often known as the antithesis of Sonic the Hedgehog and his morals can be a little questionable since he is willing to do whatever is necessary to achieve his goals.

Shadow first appeared in Sonic Adventure 2 in 2001, and he was originally intended to be a pure villain to Sonic, but the positive fan reaction to his dark and brooding nature changed the way his character developed, becoming a rival of sorts to Sonic rather than a straight-up bad guy. His original design as a villain and his continuing feud with Sonic make him a compelling antihero to add to the other, more villainous characters listed here.

7 Oggdo Bogdo and Spawn of Oggdo

Space Frogs from Hell

  • Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor
  • No voice actors because they are giant frog monsters

Next are two characters that are put together, because even though they are separate boss battles across two games, they are pretty much the same, even though Spawn of Oggdo is more difficult than the original Oggdo.

The first Oggdo Bogdo is a giant, frog-like predator, and boss fight found on the planet of Bogano in the Outer Rim that players can face while playing Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order . He is then avenged by his child, Spawn of Oggdo, in the second game Star Wars Jedi: Survivor in a boss battle that is even more difficult (and causes a lot of rage quits around the world). These frog boys are some of the most frustrating animal boss fights in gaming.

6 Alduin

World Eater

  • English VA: Daniel Riordan

Alduin is one of the major antagonists from across the Elder Scrolls franchises, and he makes the cut despite being a mythical dragon. As well as being known as the World-Eater, Aludin also has a reputation as the Twilight God and the First Dragon.

Although he is referenced in The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind , it is in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim where he becomes a major threat, as he is the main antagonist of the game that the player will eventually need to defeat during the main questline. His huge stature, demonic dragon design, and major role in Skyrim make Alduin a prominent animal villain in gaming.

5 King Dedede

Penguin Perpetrator

  • The Kirby Franchise
  • Japanese VA: Shinya Kumazaki, Masashiro Sakurai ( Super Smash Bros games, Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards )
  • English VA: Ted Lewis

King Dedede is another character that was originally designed to be a villain but has since developed into more of a playful rival and even a friend to Kirby in the latest games. King Dedede is a giant blue penguin-like creature who wields a hammer and wears a fancy red and white royal robe.

Despite no longer being a villain in the Kirby games, Dedede still makes it onto our list as he did spend his first few appearances being a villain, such as in his first appearance in Kirbyâ€™s Dream Land where he stole the food from the residents of Dream Land simply to cause sadness among the people. Even though he has since turned over a new leaf, some - unlike Kirby - cannot forgive and forget his crimes.

4 Dingodile

Dastard from Down Under

  • The Crash Bandicoot franchise.
  • Japanese VA: Keisuke Ishida
  • English VA: William Hootkins (1998), David Anthony Pizzuto (1999), Dwight Schultz (2003- 2004), Nolan North (2007), and Fred Tatasciore (2017to present)

There are all sorts of animal villains/minions in the Crash Bandicoot series, with some being more villainous and others converting to the side of good at some point in the series. Dingodile makes the cut for this ranking, as he is primarily an antagonist throughout the Crash games.

Dingodile is a half-dingo, half-crocodile hybrid, and by the time the events of Crash Bandicoot 4: Itâ€™s About Time rolls around, he has retired from his role as a villain to open up his own diner (which serves only the worst possible food). When the diner is destroyed, he ends up pulled into an interdimensional rift and eventually teams up with Crash and his sister Coco along with an alternate version of Tawna Bandicoot.

Dingodile is an iconic animal villain thanks to his unusual hybrid design, iconic flamethrower weapon, and his thick tail, which he also uses against enemies. He was once simply a villain but is now more of a contractor (and a small business owner) who will offer help to friends and foes alike if it benefits him.

3 King K. Rool

Cruel Kremling

  • The Donkey Kong Series
  • Japanese VA: Toshihide Tsuchiya
  • English VA: Chris Sutherland, Ben Campbell ( Donkey Kong Country television show)

Some of the animals here have been morally gray rather than straight-up evil, but the same canâ€™t be said for King K.Rool. As his little golden crown suggests, he is the ruler of the Kremlings (a crocodile-like species) from the Donkey Kong series. His name is also a dead giveaway when it comes to what type of ruler he is, as the Kremlings arenâ€™t particularly fond of K.Rool because of his cruel nature, even to his own people.

K.Rool is a large, obese Kremling with an eye-catching golden belly, golden bracelets, and a red cape. He enjoys terrorizing his people, but his main role in the series is to play the villain to the Kongs. His hobbies include stealing the Kong's bananas, likely to try and starve them, and kidnapping. K.Rool is a particularly volatile villain, with an unhinged nature that makes him unpredictable. His huge, misshapen, and somewhat crazy eyes only hint at the insanity that this Kremling is willing to impose on Kong and his subjects, making him a particularly noteworthy animal villain.

2 Donkey Kong

Bananarama

  • The Super Mario and Donkey Kong series
  • Japanese VA: Takashi Nagasako (2004 to present-universal VA from 2013 to present), KÅichi Yamadera ( Donkey Kong Countr y animated series), Koji Takeda (The 2023 animated Super Mario Bros Movie ).
  • English VA: Soupy Sales (1983-1984), Garry Chalk(1989-1991), Charles Martinet (1994), Mark Betteridge (1994 to 1996), Grant Kirkhope (1993 to 2013), Richard Yearwood ( Donkey Kong Country animated series), Sterling Jarvis (Singing voice in the Donkey Kong Country animated series) and Seth Rogen (The 2023 animated Super Mario Bros Movie ).

Donkey Kong might be known as an ally to Mario and a standalone hero in his own right by gamers today, but he began life way back in 1981 as the title antagonist of the Donkey Kong a rcade game. Mario was the protagonist of the game, and players would dodge barrels thrown by Donkey Kong to reach him and rescue his kidnapped victim Pauline.

All Donkey Kong did was throw stuff at Mario, but the game and his character were so popular that he ended up getting a fully fleshed-out backstory, his own game series, an animated television show, and even a family of fellow Kongs who would also get their own video games. Donkey Kong is much more than just a villain all these years after his initial conception, but his role as one of the first major animal antagonists in a game makes him one of the most iconic animal villains in gaming history.

1 Bowser

King Koopa

  • The Super Mario series
  • Universal VAs: Scott Burns (2002 to 2010), Kenny James (2005- present), Eric Newsome (2007),
  • Japanese VAs in other media: Akiko Wada (1986), Masasharu Sato (1989), Takeshi Watabe (1991), Takanobu Hozumi (1993), Hiroshi Arikawa (1993), Naoki Tatsuta (1997), and Kenta Miyake (The 2023 animated Super Mario Bros Movie )
  • English VAs in other media: Harvey Atkin (1989 to 1991), Rob Wallace (1992), Bruce Robertson (1994), Marc Graue (1994), Jack Black (The 2023 animated Super Mario Bros Movie )

Arguably one of the most iconic villains in gaming, Bowser wins the top spot despite being from a fictional species of turtle-like creatures called Koopas. In this ranking, he counts as a mythical animal of sorts, as despite his turtle-like traits, he also has various similarities to a dragon, such as his ability to breathe fire and certain elements of his appearance.

As mentioned, Bowser is not only an iconic animal/creature villain, but he is generally one of the most well-known and well-received bad guys in video game history. Following his debut in Super Mario Bros in 1985, Bowser has gone on to become a staple in the Mario franchise. His endgame goal usually revolves around kidnapping Princess Peach, conquering her kingdom, and making her his queen, which sounds a lot weirder than it actually is. Itâ€™s a simple premise, but one that connected well with gamers.

Bowser became even more popular after the release of the animated Super Mario Bros Movie in 2023, as the writers doubled down on his desire to make Peach his queen to the point where the character sings a song proclaiming his love for her (sung by his VA Jack Black). The song made it into the charts around the world. It's clear that Bowser has become much more than a simple video game animal villain. He has become a pop culture icon in his own right, and because of this, he has more than earned his place as number one.

item.title: Pokemon GO Player Has an 8-Year-Old Egg
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO players can obtain eggs of varying rarities and types, which can only be hatched by walking specific distances.
  • The oldest egg in one Pokemon GO player's inventory dates back to August 2016, showcasing a rare item in the game.
  • August brings surprises for players hatching eggs, with rare Pokemon like Larvesta available in all egg distances.

A Pokemon GO player has made an impression by revealing that they have an eight-year-old egg in their inventory. Pokemon GO has a variety of mainline game mechanics, including egg hatching. Pokemon GO players obtain eggs in different activities and can get critters of varying rarities and types. While some are more common, there are still Pokemon that Pokemon GO trainers can get only through eggs.

It all starts when, having obtained an egg, the Pokemon GO player places it in an incubator to discover the Pokemon that will come out of it. The next step is to walk the required distance to hatch the egg, which can be 2km, 5km, 7km, 10km, or 12km. It's also worth noting that while the 2km eggs are the most common because they are obtained by spinning PokeStops, the 12km eggs are considered rarer since they drop as a reward when trainers defeat the Team GO Rocket leaders. Getting an egg is a highlight for a Pokemon GO player, but one trainer has revealed that they have an impressively old egg.

Surprising other players, Reddit user PokeBlake33 revealed that they have an eight-year-old egg in their Pokemon GO inventory. They shared a screenshot showing their 2km egg received on August 20, 2016, in Berkeley, U.S.A. In July 2016, Pokemon GO was launched after an April Fools test on Google Maps, and quickly became a huge phenomenon that would create a community of millions of players from around the world.

Pokemon GO Players Still Keep Old Eggs in Their Inventories

While the egg the OP has in their Pokemon GO inventory is old, the comments section revealed that they are not the only ones to own such an item. Another Pokemon GO player showed that the oldest egg they own is from July 31, 2016, and curiously, two other players showed that they have eggs from the same date. A fourth trainer revealed they were about to hatch a Pokemon GO egg from July 14 of the same year, but didn't note which Pokemon they got.

For Pokemon GO players planning to hatch eggs in August, the current egg chart promises a few surprises. This month, players have the chance to hatch Larvesta, one of Pokemon GO 's rarest Pokemon, into eggs of all distances. Other notable examples include Togepi and Pichu (2 km eggs), Sprigatito, Quaxly and Fuecoco (5 km eggs), Frigibax and Jangmo-o (10 km eggs), and Larvitar (12 km eggs).

item.title: Pokemon GO: How to Get Dragon Ascent
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Teach Rayquaza Dragon Ascent in Pokemon GO
  • How To Build Mega Rayquaza In Pokemon GO

Pokemon GO has been adding Pokemon to its Pokedex for years, but one of the most popular is Rayquaza, the Legendary dragon Pokemon from Generation 3. Considering players can turn it into Mega Rayquaza by using Mega Energy, it is no wonder everyone wants this Pokemon.

However, before Pokemon GO players can Mega Evolve their Rayquaza, they will need to teach the Legendary Gen 3 Pokemon a specific move called Dragon Ascent, which isn't the easiest move to teach the Pokemon. Here's how to do that and get the amazing Mega form.

Update by Erin Rice on August 6, 2024: This update adds more information about Rayquaza and how to teach it Dragon Ascent. It has also removed the language surrounding Pokemon GO Fest 2023, which is when the article was originally written.

How to Teach Rayquaza Dragon Ascent in Pokemon GO

Unfortunately, as of this writing, the only way to teach Rayquaza Dragon Ascent is to get a Meteorite. In order to obtain this item, players will need to complete specific Research Tasks or defeat Mega Rayquaza in a Raid and hope that a Meteorite is given as a prize for winning.

Giving Rayquaza this item will make it learn Dragon Ascent, which is needed before Mega Evolving it. Thankfully, giving it to Rayquaza is super simple; players just need to click on the Pokemon and navigate to where it says Evolve. Once there, select the option and the Meteorite will be used on the Pokemon, Mega Evolving it.

Players will not always get a Meteorite from defeating Mega Rayquaza in Raids. Instead, this is a very rare item, meaning it may take quite a few Raids before even obtaining it for the first time.

How To Build Mega Rayquaza In Pokemon GO

After obtaining the Pokemon, players will want to have the best build possible for it. When looking at builds, most Pokemon will want the highest damage attacks. In order to do this, players will want to consider the following moves:

  • Fast Move: Dragon Tail (Air Slash can work if needed)
  • Charged Move: Dragon Ascent (This is the best overall, but Outrage could also work for Dragon Tail or Air Slash. Keep in mind, Dragon Ascent is needed to Mega Evolve, so without it, players cannot have the Mega Rayquaza.)
